member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getGui const
member.summary: Returns the parent Gui for a window. If the window is nested, this Gui differs from SelfGui.
member.returns: Gui instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getSelfGui const
member.summary: Returns Gui instance for a window. This Gui remains unchanged during the whole lifecycle of the window.
member.returns: Gui instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getDisplayIndex const
member.summary: Returns the number of the display, on which the window is currently displayed. For separate windows, this index is requested from the system proxy; for nested windows, the index is provided based on the location of the client center point.
member.returns: The number of the display, on which the window is currently displayed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isNested const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the object is a nested window or group of windows.
member.returns: true for a nested window or group of windows, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isSeparate const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the object is a separate window or group of windows.
member.returns: true for a separate window or group of windows, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setPosition(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the top left corner of the window in the screen coordinates. In case of several displays, the position is relative to the main display. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The window screen position (coordinates of the top left corner).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getPosition const
member.summary: Returns the position of the top left corner of the window in the screen coordinates. In case of several displays, the position is relative to the main display. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: The window screen position (coordinates of the top left corner).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setClientPosition(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the top left corner of the client (the window content area without the top bar and borders) in the screen coordinates. In case of several displays, the position is relative to the main display. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The screen position of the client (coordinates of the top left corner).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClientPosition const
member.summary: Returns the position of the top left corner of the client (the window content area without the top bar and borders) in the screen coordinates. In case of several displays, the position is relative to the main display. For a nested window, the window position is returned.
member.returns: The screen position of the client (coordinates of the top left corner).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClientLocalPosition const
member.summary: Returns the position of the top left corner of the client (the window content area without the top bar and borders) relative to the window position.
member.returns: The screen position of the client (coordinates of the top left corner) relative to the window position.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.moveToCenter
member.summary: Positions the window so that the client center coincides with the center of the current display. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the engine window size (i.e. including the sizing border). This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getSize const
member.summary: Returns the engine window size (i.e. including the sizing border). This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: The engine window size.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClientSize const
member.summary: Returns the size of the window lient (content) area.
member.returns: The size of the client area.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setMinSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the minimum possible window size when resizing the window. If the value is more than the current maximum size, use the setMinAndMaxSize() method, to change both values at once. Otherwise the value will be clamped to the current maximum size. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The minimum possible size of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getMinSize const
member.summary: Returns the minimum possible window size when resizing the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return zero values.
member.returns: The minimum possible size of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setMaxSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the maximum possible window size when resizing the window. If the value is less than the current minimum size, use the setMinAndMaxSize() method, to change both values at once. Otherwise the value will be clamped to the current minimum size. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The maximum possible size of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getMaxSize const
member.summary: Returns the maximum possible window size when resizing the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return (1000000, 1000000).
member.returns: The maximum possible size of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setMinAndMaxSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the minimum and maximum possible window size when resizing the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The minimum possible size of the window.
The maximum possible size of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setTitle(char)
member.summary: Sets the text of the title for the window. For a separate window, the title is set via system proxy in the title bar only; for a nested window, it is also set in the tab of the parent group.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getTitle const
member.summary: Returns the text of the title for the window. For a separate window, the icon is set via system proxy in the title bar only; for a nested window, it is also set in the tab of the parent group.
member.returns: The title for the engine window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setIcon(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
member.summary: Sets the icon for the window.
member.returns: 1 if the specified icon is successfully set for the window, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getIcon const
member.summary: Returns the icon for the engine window.
member.returns: 1 if the icon for the window is returned successfully, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setOpacity(float)
member.summary: Sets the opacity for the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getOpacity const
member.summary: Returns the current opacity for the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will always return 1.0f.
member.returns: The opacity for the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setBordersEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Enables and disables the borders for the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: true to enable the borders for the window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isBordersEnabled const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the borders are enabled for the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return false.
member.returns: true if the borders are enabled for the window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setBorderSize(int)
member.summary: Sets the engine window border size. This value is applied to the windows in the engine style only. For system-style windows system settings are applied. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getBorderSize const
member.summary: Returns the engine window border size. This value is applied to the windows in the engine style only. For system-style windows system settings are applied. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return 0.
member.returns: The engine window border size.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setResizable(bool)
member.summary: Enables and disables the possibility to resize the engine window by the mouse. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: true to make the engine window resizable by the mouse, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isResizable const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the engine window is resizable by the mouse. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return false.
member.returns: true if the engine window is resizable by the mouse, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.show

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isShown const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if a widget is rendered. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: true if the engine window is rendered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.hide
member.summary: Disables rendering of the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isHidden const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if a widget is hidden. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: true if the engine window isn't rendered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setFocus
member.summary: Sets the focus to the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isFocused const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the window is currently in focus. For a separate or parent window, the returned value coinsides with the value returned by isSystemFocused().
member.returns: true if the engine window is in focus, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setSystemFocus
member.summary: Sets the focus to the engine window. This method is applied to a separate or parent window, for nested windows use setFocus().

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isSystemFocused const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the engine window is currently in focus. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: true if the engine window is in focus, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.minimize

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isMinimized const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the engine window is minimized to tray. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: true if the engine window is minimized, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.maximize
member.summary: Makes the engine window as large as possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isMaximized const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the engine window is maximized. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.restore
member.summary: Restores the size and position of the minimized or maximized engine window via the system proxy. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getHitTestResult(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating in which area of the engine window the mouse is located. This method is used for interaction with system windows only, i.e. it cannot be used for nested windows.

member.returns: Value indicating the window area, one of the HITTEST_* values.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getHitTestResultName(EngineWindow::HITTEST) const
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the hit test result value.
member.param: Value indicating the window area, one of the HITTEST_* values.
member.returns: The string representation of the hit test result value (e.g., HITTEST_RESIZE_RIGHT is RESIZE RIGHT).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getOrder const
member.summary: Returns the order of the window. This value allows comparing which window is closer to the viewer (a relatively smaller value). This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: The order of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toTop
member.summary: Makes the window appear on top of all other windows. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setAlwaysOnTop(bool)
member.summary: Sets the window to always be rendered above the other windows. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: true to render the window always on top; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isAlwaysOnTop const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the window is always rendered above the other windows. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return the value of the global parent group.
member.returns: true if the window is always on top; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getParentGroup const
member.summary: Returns the group into which the current window is nested, or nullptr if it is a separate window.
member.returns: The group into which the current window is nested, or nullptr if it is a separate window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getGlobalParentGroup const
member.summary: Returns the top group of the hierarchy into which the current window is nested, or nullptr if it is a separate window.
member.returns: The top group of the hierarchy into which the current window is nested, or nullptr if it is a separate window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isGlobalChildOf(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup})
member.summary: Returns the value specifying if the current window is a part of a hierarchy of the specified window.
member.returns: true if the current window is globally a child of the specified one, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.updateGuiHierarchy
member.summary: Updates the hierarchy for all widgets â€” the widgets are arranged, expanded to the required sizes and then their positions are updated. Updating the hierarchy may be required, for example, for getting the screen position immediately after the widget has been added to the hierarchy. For a separate window, the hierarchy in self gui is updated; for a nested window, the hierarchy in self gui of the global parent group is updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getNumDroppedItems const
member.summary: Returns the total number of files and/or folders dropped to the window.
member.returns: The number of dropped files and/or folders.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getDroppedItem(int) const
member.summary: Returns the absolute path to the file or folder dropped to the window.
member.param: Index of the dropped file or folder.
member.returns: Absolute path to the dropped file or folder.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getID const
member.summary: Returns the ID of the engine window, which is unchanged during the whole lifecycle of the window.
member.returns: ID of the engine window, if the window is external.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.screenshot(char)
member.summary: Creates a screenshot after the rendering stage is completed. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setHoldEngine(bool)
member.summary: Sets the value indicating if the engine can stop operating (quit automatically) while this window is open.
member.param: true if the engine can't stop operating while this window is open, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isHoldEngine const
member.summary: Sets the value indicating if the engine can stop operating (quit automatically) while this window is open.
member.returns: true if the engine can't stop operating while this window is open, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setIgnoreSystemClose(bool)
member.summary: Sets the value indicating if this window can be closed using the OS methods (ALT+F4 or cross in the top-right corner of the window).
member.param: If true, the window can't be closed using the OS methods.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isIgnoreSystemClose const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if this window can be closed using the OS methods (ALT+F4 or cross in the top-right corner of the window).
member.returns: If true, the window can't be closed using the OS methods.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setModal(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Sets the current window modal to the specified parent window. Both the parent and the child windows must be separate. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isModal const
member.summary: Checks if the window is modal. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return false.
member.returns: true if the window is modal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isModalParent const
member.summary: Checks if this window is parent for any modal window. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return false.
member.returns: true if the window is parent for any modal window; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getModalParent const
member.summary: Returns the modal parent of the window. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return nullptr.
member.returns: The modal parent of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.addModalWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Adds the argument window as modal to the current window. Both the parent and the child windows must be separate. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.
member.param: Window to be added as modal.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.removeModalWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Removes the argument modal window from this window. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getNumModalWindows const
member.summary: Returns the total number of modal windows for this window. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return 0.
member.returns: The total number of modal windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getModalWindow(int) const
member.summary: Returns the modal window for this window by its index. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return nullptr.
member.returns: Modal window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.unstack
member.summary: Removes the current window from a parent group.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getType const
member.summary: Returns the type of the engine window.
member.returns: The type of the engine window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getTypeName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the engine window type as a string.
member.returns: The string representation of the engine window type.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setTitleBarEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Enables and disables the title bar for the window. This value is applied to the windows in the engine style only. For system-style windows system settings are applied. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: true to enable the title bar for the engine window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isTitleBarEnabled const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the title bar is enabled for the window. This value is applied to the windows in the engine style only. For system-style windows system settings are applied. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return false.
member.returns: true if the title bar is enabled for the engine window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setTitleBarHeight(int)
member.summary: Sets the height of the window title bar. This value is applied to the windows in the engine style only. For system-style windows system settings are applied. This method can be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The engine window title bar height.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getTitleBarHeight const
member.summary: Returns the height of the window title bar. This value is applied to the windows in the engine style only. For system-style windows system settings are applied. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return 0.
member.returns: The engine window title bar height.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setSystemStyle(bool)
member.summary: Sets the system style for the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: true to set the default system style for the engine window, false to set the engine-style window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isSystemStyle const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the default system style is set for the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return false.
member.returns: true if the default system style is set for the engine window; false if the engine style is set for the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setEngineStyle(bool)
member.summary: Sets the engine style for the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: true to set the engine style for the engine window, false to set the default system style.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isEngineStyle const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the engine style is set for the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return true.
member.returns: true if the engine style is set for the engine window; false if the default system style is set for the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setSizingBorderSize(int)
member.summary: Sets the size of the border in the widget that is manipulated to resize the window. This method should not be applied to a system-style window with enabled borders, as the system settings cannot be changed. This method should not be applied to nested windows.
member.param: The size of the border that is manipulated to resize the window, in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getSizingBorderSize const
member.summary: Returns the size of the border in the widget that is manipulated to resize the window. This method should be applied to an engine-style window, for an unmodified system-style window (i.e. with the enabled border size), the system value is applied. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return 0.
member.returns: The size of the border in the widget that is manipulated to resize the window, in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.close
member.summary: Deletes the window if this window is not a modal parent or a member of a fixed group. If a window is a member of a fixed group, it cannot be closed (i.e. deleted).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setCanBeNested(bool)
member.summary: Sets the value indicating if the engine window can be used as a nested window.
member.param: true to enable usage of the engine window as a nested window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isCanBeNested const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the engine window can be used as a nested window.
member.returns: true if usage of the engine window as a nested window is enabled, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setCanCreateGroup(bool)
member.summary: Sets the value indicating if the engine window can become a group.
member.param: true to enable usage of the engine window as a group, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isCanCreateGroup const

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stack(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,int,bool)
member.summary: Stacks the window to the other window. If the first argument is the separate window, a new window group is returned. If the first argument is the nested window, the window is added to its group. group_1 will consist of 3 windows: window_1 and window_3 stacked vertically and window_2 stacked horizontally.
member.param: The parent window to which another window is stacked.
Type of a group to be created.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first group.
member.returns: Group of stacked windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackToParentGroup(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,bool)
member.summary: Stacks the second window to the parent window group of the first window. In the result, both windows passed as arguments will be on the same level in the group hierarchy. If the first window has no parent group, the function will return it as is.
member.param: The window into the parent group of which the other window is stacked.
A place where a window or a group should be placed in a group.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first window or a group.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackWindows(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE)
member.summary: Returns a newly created group of the separate and/or nested windows. You cannot stack the window group to the separate window, however, you can stack a window nested in the window group: in this case, the window will be unstacked from its parent group and added to the new one. The windows are stacked in the default order. For example: group_1 will be a vertical group of window_3 and window_1.
member.param: Type of a group to be created.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackWithWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,bool)
member.summary: Returns a newly created group of the engine window viewport and any other engine window â€” another viewport or a window group.
member.param: The window viewport to be stacked.
Type of a window group to be created.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first group.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackGroups(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE)
member.summary: Returns the group of window groups. The second group is added to the first group. To combine two windows or a group and a window, use the stack() method.
member.param: The first window group for merging.
The second window group for merging.
Type of a group to be created.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackToGroup(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,bool)
member.summary: Stacks the window or window group to another window group. The updated group of windows is returned.

The window or window group to be stacked.
A place where a window or a group should be placed in a group.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge and combine with the first group.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getDpiAwareness const
member.summary: Returns the DPI awareness mode, the value indicating how the application processes the DPI scaling. The value is set to PER_MONITOR_AWARE by default. On Windows, if a specified mode cannot be set, it will switch to a possible lower value with a corresponding warning. On Linux, PER_MONITOR_AWARE is currently not supported, setting this value will switch the mode to the SYSTEM_AWARE mode with the corresponding warning in the console. This value is stored in the boot config file and can be changed only at the application startup. It cannot be changed at runtime, thus at an attempt to change the value the console will show the corresponding warning.
member.returns: The DPI awareness mode, the value indicating how the application processes the DPI scaling.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getCurrentDpiAwareness const
member.summary: Returns the current actual DPI awareness mode, the value indicating how the application processes the DPI scaling. The value is set to PER_MONITOR_AWARE by default. On Windows, if a specified mode cannot be set, it will switch to a possible lower value with a corresponding warning. On Linux, PER_MONITOR_AWARE is currently not supported, setting this value will switch the mode to the SYSTEM_AWARE mode with the corresponding warning in the console. This is an actual value, it may differ from the mode stored in the boot config file (in case the system cannot set the specified mode it will try to use the one that is suitable instead).
member.returns: Current actual DPI awareness mode, the value indicating how the application processes the DPI scaling.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.isAutoDpiScaling const
member.summary: Returns the value specifying if automatic DPI scaling is applied to the window. If automatic DPI scaling is disabled, all GUI elements have the 100% size, only the system window size is scaled. This value is stored in the boot config file and can be changed only at the application startup. It cannot be changed at runtime, thus at an attempt to change the value the console will show the corresponding warning.
member.returns: true if all GUI elements of the window are scaled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: The DPI level of the main system display is obtained. Only with this DPI level the image is displayed clearly. Displays with another DPI level of changing of the DPI value on the main system display while running the application will cause the image blurring.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowManager.DPI_AWARENESS_UNAWARE
member.summary: Scaling is not taken into account. Windows are displayed with the default DPI level of 96 (100%). The operating system will stretch the raster part of the window and it will look blurry.
